title: Understanding MFA
text: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is a security measure that requires more than one form of verification to access an account or system.

title: Why Use MFA?
text: MFA is used to enhance security by adding an extra layer of protection beyond just a password.

hintAnswer: To enhance security by requiring multiple forms of verification
title: Benefits of MFA
text: What is the primary benefit of using multi-factor authentication?
choices: To enhance security by requiring multiple forms of verification
To reduce the need for passwords
